Package runner

Class ScatterPlot

java.lang.Object
org.jzy3d.analysis.AbstractAnalysis
runner.ScatterPlot
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.jzy3d.analysis.IAnalysis
Direct Known Subclasses:
ShiftedSpikeScatterPlotRunner, WeatherScatterPlot
public abstract class ScatterPlot
extends org.jzy3d.analysis.AbstractAnalysis
A ScatterPlot displaying a set of points in 3d space. The 3d model can than be viewed from different angles to allow for a good visualization of the structure of the plotted data.

Every implementation of this class must provide a method getPoints() that returns the points including their colors to be plotted.

This class is build upon the jzy3d library providing most of the functionality.

Author:
Anton Ballmaier

  • Field Details

    • pointSize

      private final float pointSize
      The size of plotted points in pixels. The points will be drawn as squares with this value as their side length. Generally, higher values should be used for smaller data sets.

  • Constructor Details

    • ScatterPlot

      protected ScatterPlot​(float pointSize)
      Constructs a new ScatterPlot object using the given point size.
      Parameters:
      pointSize - the size of plotted points in pixels. The points will be drawn as squares with this value as their side length.

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init()
      Initialization code used by the jzy3d framework to create a scatter plot.

      The scatter plot is specified in a way so that it will always remain correctly proportioned.

    • plot

      public void plot()
      Opens a new window containing the 3d scatter plot of this instances points. The 3d model can than be viewed from different angles to allow for a good visualization of the structure of the plotted data.

    • getPoints

      protected abstract java.util.List<org.jzy3d.plot3d.primitives.LightPoint> getPoints()
      Returns the set of LightPoints to be plotted. Every LightPoint contains information about the position and the color of a single point.
      Returns:
      the list of colored points to be plotted
